column5: Looking for input...I have a cousin that I want to take to Canada for his first fishing trip. I will go to either Mahkwa Lodge on Lac Suel or Indianhead Lodge on LOW. Will use the AP plan at either. If you have been to either, I would appreciate your thoughts on them. Will be going in August 2020

Indianhead is a great camp with really (I mean really) nice lodging. Short distance to Whitefish Bay. We fished it in mid June and did pretty well. The smallmouth fishing is fantastic. Walleyes, to get any consistency, we had to find the tannic water and we had to trip a ways. I would go back there in a heartbeat. Lodge owners are great and it was really affordable. Haven't been to the Lac Seul camp you mentioned, but I would speculate that the walleye fishing there would probably be a lot easier.
